job-1.name: Monitor de Ventas en Restauración
description: MVR is a platform that provides complete weekly insights on the fast-food market. Clients from different companies have access to comprehensive data and analysis of their performance against the market and / or direct competitors

job-2.name: Big Data Team - Data Scientist Profile Exams
description: BDT at El Corte Inglés requested a solution to allow their candidates to take technical exams remotely. I developed an application to retrieve candidate personal information from Moodle. The exam presented them with a battery of randomly selected questions, as well as code tests to prove their Python and SQL knowledge and skills. I needed to research a custom-made solution to send the PDF of the exam to Moodle, so the recruiters could download them from the candidates’ profiles.
tasks: Research of a solution to a special request of the client

job-3.name: UTC
description: SUITS, SL is a company that operates vehicles for enforcing traffic laws. They contacted me to update the frontend of an existing application they were using, which was built with outdated technologies that prevented them from scaling. I eventually also assisted with modernizing the backend.

job-4.name: PAE & GAE
description: This is a collection of five different sites that were deployed on the company's intranet regarding the new insurance products they were launching to the market between 2020 and 2022. The strongest point was the graphic design and use of multimedia assets.

job-5.name: CityXplorer
description: CityXplorer is the foundation of EYSA's business. It enables city halls worldwide to handle parking spots, traffic fines, parking meters and traffic enforcement cars and access. I consider this as the most significant project I have been a part of in terms of the technologies used. It covers everything, from user management to monitoring the location of human controllers and cars, and a fully customizable dashboard with various widgets such as graphs, traffic camera in real time, and maps.

job-6.name: Nueva Colección de Sartenes
description: This project was a game that was used to showcase the new collection of pans to salespeople in shopping centers across the country. The application had an eye-catching visual style and animations, and presented the complete catalog of pans, as well as an analysis of the materials they were made of. It was a great success and served as a model for similar products in the following years.

job-7.name: Seguridad en la Información III
description: This project was the third in a series focused on information security. The IT department requested an application built using React, which would present employees with simulated phishing emails and other deceptive information. The goal of the application was to train employees to identify suspicious information and to track where and when they clicked within the simulated emails, among other things.

job-8.name: ParkXplorer Demo - ReactJS
description: This was the second demonstration, and it was the one that convinced EYSA managers to choose React over Angular to develop CityXplorer.

job-9.name: ParkXplorer Demo - Angular 2
description: EYSA reached out for a demonstration of my skills to evaluate my ability to develop their most significant project to date, CityXplorer. They were deciding between Angular and React for the frontend, and this was the first demonstration as part of that decision-making process.

job-10.name: Generación de Informes
description: The company’s managers requested an app to be deployed on their intranet as part of their modernization efforts. The purpose of this app is to allow them to generate reports on various topics.

job-11.name: Gestión de Inversiones
description: After a small demonstration using Angular 1.x, a request was made as part of a series of tools to aid investors in managing their portfolios. This was the first time I deployed a professional application built with Angular 2. It was done as it was coming out of beta.

job-12.name: POS PSD2 Simulators
description: This project involved building a collection of POS simulators for Repsol - Gespevesa employees to meet PSD2 compliance requirements. The simulators were designed to simulate different payment scenarios, including various payment methods and customer purchases of products and services.

job-13.name: E-Learning Solutions
description: I’ve deployed hundreds of digital products like SCORM courses and websites in collaboration with ECI’s HR team. Those products comprehend almost every aspect of El Corte Inglés business (fashion, travel, house appliances, insurances). All of this while shaping their workflow through the years including new technologies research and adoption.
